body: "With Boomers turning 71 this year, investors for the first time ever must start taking withdrawals from traditional retirement accounts.  The buy & hold mantra that was their friend in the past could become their foe in the future.   We should be about the business of getting investors fully prepared in advance for the good, the bad, and the unforeseen."
"the environment their offering thrives in and the economic conditions causing stress to their offering"
"Taylored information that is specific to my practice."
"Simple talking points weekly on market performance, projections, and recommendations."
"Help with internal office organization / business growth"

"I use different websites for different information, and get most of what I need.  Sometimes would like more in-depth coverage of earnings; sometimes transcripts help, sometimes not so much.  Ditto re MD&A in certain 10ks."
"Need more efficient reporting of fund performance attribution and discussion via manager commentary. Some fund families are better than others."
"better communication on changes within portfolios and plans to stay ahead of volatility"
"Better compliance approved reference materials and sales aids.  Better portfolio construction and analytical software."
"Updates on the ever changing fee landscape to stay competitive"
"Morningstar is critical to my business for analyzing client portfolios, analyzing individual holdings and bringing industry news from a single source."
"less sales ideas - need more on global movement of capital and those impacts"
"logical explanations for things that don't make sense"
"I think I'm getting what I need."
"I'd like to be plugged into the Research Departments of the major member firms."
"I have more information than I can process in one day."
"Better info on CEFs, including charts of Z-Scores versus historical Z-Scores."
"Most do a good job of keeping updated portfolio manager thoughts and reasoning for fund positioning."
"More timely and accurate information. Too much opinions and not enough facts"
"trends in the financial markets in a timely fashion"
"I need better returns from the mutual fund managers to legitimize the advisor fees and to keep pace with benchmarks."
"In depth company information to invest in"
"I don't feel any need for improvement."
"I seem to have all I need"
"I receive all I need from them"
"Market commentary that is relevant to the client experience"
"Not a lot.  Most asset managers are pretty happy to meet and talk whenever needed."
"I don't rely on info/services from asset managers."
"offshore, NRA client information (available investments, taxation, compliance, etc)"
"Insight to long term trends in sectors"

"Big picture themes and trends. Also, tools to make it easier to explain/share insights with clients. Most financial information coming from asset managers today is VERY technical and that's OK for professionals but not for clients."
"if they could read a crystal ball that would be wonderful"
"Asset inflows and outflows.  Also how at risk the different firms would be if there were \"a run on the bank\" with the fund."
"Timely information and more accessibility and availability of managers"
"Volume of information too much. Need to quickly filter info."
"We rarely get information updates from asset managers we worth with, so we could stand to see broad improvement there."
"Easier access to a greater range of sources"
"more concise and focused reports, less political bias"
"Proactive market/economic insight non-related to a sales idea.  Too often they are spinning news to sell their product."
"integration relationships among companies that are in client portfolios"
"Objective news reporting versus lots of coverage about predictions and forecasts"
"Asset managers communicate wonderfully when they have a good performance story to tell, and poorly when they don't"
"Probably none.  It's all out there if you look hard enough to find it"
"nothing I am happy with the information I receive"
"online support, access I can use with out them"
"More information that I can tailor either to specific clients or to specific life events or stages"
"Market conditions, how the economy and politic affect it."
"I could use regular updates and detailed information for things to watch out for in the market."
"I get all the information I need from my research team, who obtain them from multiple sources.  We have what we need."
"Timely topics on what's going on and how it relates to the markets"
"Accurate and timely information that is not an opinion"
"some don't provide great commentary on what they are doing."
"More consistent market commentary as it relates to their management style and portfolio"
"daily updates for positions I hold with them...updates on performance, mgmt., volume, etc."
"Historic P/B, price & P/B download using API."
"Better, cheaper, and more consistent access to financial data, particularly fixed income indices and data (performance, attributes, historical prices)"
"Not sure, I feel we have a lot at our disposal and serve our clients well."
"Better projections of how automatization is going to impact the US employment market."
"Better ways to service my clients while not taking an overwhelming amount of time"
"I like unbiased information to help me direct my allocations for my clients portfolios"
"Multiple sources and viewpoints. I find that fewer wholesalers understand the market"
"More independent research rather than hearing from the fund companies about their own stuff"
"I'm not sure.  I feel that the asset manager companies that we work with and who calls on us do provide good information.  With that, I make my own decisions on what to add to client portfolios."
"Consolidated information and interpretation that I trust to be accurate"
"Sentiment of clients and the things they are looking for. Want to answer question they have based on what they hear outside of the office."
"Constant unbiased education on new concepts in wealth management."
"We are asset managers and do not outsource that for clients"
"I am getting what I need at this time"
"I don't always need to know what everyone is doing...more about what they are not and what they are missing to help find where to go next, not where everyone already is"
"Instant updates to recommendations or asset allocations"
"Access to more information or Commentary outside of just their website"
"Trust that information is accurate and non biased"
"I have more than I can handle at this point"
"allocation and direction of markets going forward"
"app with unique information would be great"
"More unique & articulate views which challenge my strongly held beliefs"
"geo political news in relation to market movement"
"Nothing really, there is already to much information."
"email updates regarding funds I specifically work with"
"Better services such as Fly on the wall or such targeted sources or Briefing.com."
"Average price to earning rations, and correlation to appropriate indices"
"YTM and TYW calculations on their bond funds in real time. Detailed default/impairment data on same funds."
"Data aggregation and use of AI to better serve demographics"
"What they plan on doing in the future"
"Some consolidation of news specific to my practice.  A tall feet I know but would create huge efficiencies for my practice."
"Nothing. We're in a digital world of information. If I want to find it I can at my fingertips"

"I work very closely my managers and am in constant contact with conference calls, direct access to the portfolio managers and annual meetings. I am happy with these long term relationships and do not envision any changes."
"Specific understanding of individual industries, ie. AI."

"I need someone willing to help me build relationships with clients. Maybe that's giving me some social media ideas to put out there or help me fund a client gathering. In order to use a new fund, I need a compelling story of why that theme is the place to be right now or some way they have shown consistency of process and returns over long periods."
"Just report the facts. Too much opinion."
"I need to get a better understanding of what  is concerning my clients. What keeps them up at night."
"More information about undervalued asset classes and more tactical 12-36 month asset allocation strategies."
"Direct news from the manager Direct back office/operations support"
"I would like more details and easy access to ALL The fees that a fund has."
"How to mange your business more effectively"
"asset managers are generally always bullish to help sell product.  I prefer more unbiased opinion that is product neutral"
"Clear projections on where the various markets are susceptible to risk and/or opportunity."
"Unique ways to manage and grow an RIA business."
"How to link investment strategies to planning topics and complexities for clients to create stories."
"Information is available if one is inclined to look for it"
"A great real time news feed - we have Tradestation but that isn't enough."
"None that occurs to me, other than a crystal ball."
"I have all the sources I need."
"Economic policy information that could impact earnings, equity markets and/or bond markets."
"how to integrate products for the best total package for our clients"
"I feel like I sometimes have TOOOOO much information- it's almost overwhelming how much we have to process that I have to actually turn it off"
"what to own based upon where the market conditions dictate currently"
"Simpler tools to help educate my clients on how much and where they should be saving."
"More and more technology enhancements.  More applications done over the phone and via the website."
"We are well covered and receive all needed information"
"Asset managers need to improve their trade execution quality. It seems that asset managers and hedge funds have forgotten the extremely high importance of trade execution quality."
"I feel my parent company is doing a great job of providing us with third party information and other tools we need to be great asset managers."
"default rates on municipal and corporate bonds"
"More specifics about what is going on at the portfolio leve"
"better reporting on website-distribution and capital gains information"
"non biased  statistically relevant economic and socionomic statistics"
"More timely ways to implement the strategies discussed."
"More succinct and less waste of time filtering"
"brief explanations on what changes they are making with regards to changing long/intermediate-term outlook"
"The firms that manage assets will generally slant their reporting to highlight their positives. I prefer the outside sources as mentioned earlier as they provide more unbiased reporting."
"Industry trends and best ideas regarding asset allocation and passive versus active management."
"Up to date access to performance and ranking information. As well as articles on how clients use their assets."
"Portfolio Construction Proposal Assists Client Acquisition/Review Assists"

"Ease of technology to access information.   Short concise information.  I like it when White Papers are summarized.  It is is a new article.    Have titles with bullets- then the commentary.  I fee there is TOO much information.  Too much noise.   Now more than ever it is important to have an opinion and just listen and think.  Do not get distracted from all of the noise and all of the opinions looking to sway brokers or their clients one way or the other.   Example.  with the news, one would think the DOL is All good for clients.  Our clients will pay approx .25 basis points more for the same work!  Thus what clients are hearing in the news is NOT necessarily true!"
"High level and to the point market commentary"
"I do that myself.  I construct my client portfolios. Rarely use asset managers."
"None.  I don't want to be biased based on info or services that I receive from an asset manager."
"Ideas/suggestions that do not follow the heard."
"We prefer to get most of our information from third party sources rather than asset managers.  However, we want them to be accessible when we need information or clarification"
"My asset managers meet my needs, otherwise I would replace them."
"Really can't think of anything I'm missing."
"I do not rely on asset managers.  My primary sources are WSJ, Morningstar, and independent analysts."
"More filtering of sensational news that has little long term value."
"More accurate research on retirement planning issues done by non biased university professors"
"More instantaneous news; i.e. podcasts, short articles, twitter updates."
"Unbiased, factual, verifiable news.  Don't want editorializing...leave that to the print media or, at least, label it as such."
"More frequent updates on the investment selections they are making."
"aggregate service of all new sources custimzed to my interest"
"I am satisfied. I just need investment fund profiles and performance."
"I receive too much information and services"
"Again i have too much information and news so i really need less."
"More direction on which asset allocation model is good for the current market environment.  Ways to invest in fixed income for when rates rise...etc."
"commentary in a timely manner to send to clients"
"More than enough info out there. Don't need any more."
"I feel we have plenty of sources of information to service our clients."
"Just want sources to be non-biased and accurate"
"In-depth, defendable analysis of how what they offer better meets clients' vs. the current solution"
"more updated about portfolio changes and why"
"I don't work with asset managers.  I am a sole proprietor with 40+ years in the investment business.  I don't use and don't trust most major asset managers and news sources."
"Continue to improve technology applications and relevant & timely, client-focused material."
"Centralized.  All info on one page instead of multi page"
"nothing I can think of at this time"
"how different risk affects different markets distinctly"
"I get adequate info from asset managers"
"More frequent updates on performance and market commentary."
"Prospecting methods and truly attractive unique products at a low cost to attract new clients."
"More long term strategies and stop the hype about how politics affects things on a daily basis"
"Portfolio modeling of various funds in all the asset classes"
"More updated information on product offerings, expenses, etc.  Alignment of information / service with relation to DOL."
"Demographic needs of various age groups i.e., millennials and Gen x"
"Tools to combine client presentation information across types of allocations and custodians"
"There is nothing specific I need at this time"
"More long-term context; most asset managers give information for the next year or so and rarely longer."

"I receive too much information today.  With regards to services, it really is a matter of flexibility. Being able to offer a broad range of services allows us to be better serve the needs of more clients."
"Need less information, but better quality information and less generic material"
"More information on why they are investing in whatever they are investing in."
"On command data info, up-to-date transparency and real-time analysis."
"What the client is reading and thinking."
"thoughts and ideas that are currently working within our industry"
"Info for investing that is longer term in nature"
"A place where my sources are consolidated"
"More frequency. Less new sales products and more service on existing assets. If I just tried to meet with clients and only sell new products and not service existing, I'd lose money."
"access to current trends of the market to anticipate where and when the asset managers are pivoting to different sectors"
"I need up to the date info on occasions.  They usually don't have that."
"I'm  the only one in the industry that isn't corrupt"
"low cost investments for me and my clients"

"I think most asset managers are complete garbage. They tell a compelling story and then the story doesn't perform and they make excuses. I need someone to provide better passive solutions and stop trying to beat the market."
"Asset managers that I use need to communicate their specific analysis regarding their actions; not just general blah blah blah"
"none - there is too much information to absorb already"
"Transparency of how investments are structured, performance, and fee structure"
"None. The resources are there, people need to learn to use them."
"Portfolio updates, Transparency in fees, outlook of fund"
"More in-depth and critical news on over and under valued sectors."
"Less talk about the past successes more talk about trends that are forming"
"Blending different asset allocations and factors into a portfolio whole."
"up to date allocations or positions inside their funds."
"Opinions of the fund managers ... more commentary on their views"
"Market volatility and financial information to better serve my clients"
"information on new and exciting product lines available to my clients"
"Less political talk particularly from Trump supporters, the 4 or 5 still with jobs"
"I'd like easily to consume news regarding markets."
"Need better technology tools - our firm needs to help our advisors be more mobile with computers and presentation materials."
"Input on macroeconomic changes and how they relate to my clients portfolio"
"Pdf and Power point presentation material for Ipad"
"better customer analytics, performance info, relationship mgmt info"
"how different types of markets affect investment performance.  For example, why would I invest my clients dollars in a bond fund if interest rates are to rise in the near future."
"Focus more on changing market conditions and client needs."
"plenty of information, need more relevant data to long term investing"

"Would like to hear a little more rationale versus which are the 4 and 5 star funds.   Many are also anti ETF and we use them in portfolios.   I don't like being given performance of their fund versus an ETF.  Would rather them work in conjunction with each other."
"I get pretty comprehensive information from the variety of asset managers I speak to."
"Just need more time to digest news flow"
"Expense ratios and rationale for what they are."
"Factual information from the fed which we are seldom getting if at all."
"Updates on market changes and the forecasted outlook"
"Better insight on how the market will perform in the future."
"A cheaper version of a bloomberg terminal."
"we don't invest based on current news - we try to do as we coach our clients. Don't be consumed of the news. It's not helpful."
"n/a; already receive more research than can possibly be used."
"I have access to a great deal of information"

"None.  I'm satisfied with what I get .  If I were 20 years younger my needs would be much greater.  I leave the technology etc. to my son and office staff.  Guess I'm a Planner Emeritus.  90% of my clients are retired and most are over 70 to 95"
"Macro news and what to expect for the coming week in terms of relevant news."
"less of the main stream hype and more of the educated forecast and updated regulations"
"Nothing specific comes to mind. Maybe retirement plan info."
"ideas on educational topics; beginner topics for new investors"
"I think there is enough information out there to service clients well."
"Some are better and providing information frequently as to their view and their response.  I can get it from all of them, but some are more proactive in sending the information."
"Other than flexible return data (3 month, 5 year, since inception, etc) I can't think of anything specific"
"I need my research group and my trader.  I am a relative strength guy and the reason I consume news is to answer questions a client might ask.  News stories do not enter my decision making process."
"Potential impacts to the economy; specifically student debt crises"
"Trends, comparisons in performance and historical \"what if\" comparisons"
"more analytics on markets and individual investments"
"More accurate information with regard to economic changes that will affect my clients and their financial situations."
"A way to consolidate a feed that I design."
"various needs: big picture overview (like WSJ.COM), specialized research (e.g. from Schwab) and unique ideas/topics articles"
"More insight on markets and financial products"
"I would need updated fi360 reports to help screen out their good funds and bad funds."
"need to know same info clients are receiving"
"Better communication that I can share with my clients."
"lie detectors for the managers of the funds"
"less systems where I have to enter the same information over and over"
"More comparison of fees such as a program like FeeX"
"I am satisfied with the current information sources I work with.  Additional information sources would begin to overwhelm the workday."
"I get most of what I need"

"Again, more of a comparison of investment options that show a true breakdown of the fees, benefits (historical performance), risks vs. rewards, etc.  Asset managers are willing to show you what they have that is working well, but do not give a fair comparison to their top competitors."
"I'M getting all the info that I need"
"More contact on portfolio changes and market thoughts"

"more thorough risk analysis (10 or 12 questions don't provide enough info), better retirement cash flow projections, software similar to the Morningstar software provided by Annexus for Athene and Nationwide annuities, more Monte Carlo simulations."
"I think I get mostly everything now"
"any that will keep me up with the markets"
"I’m comfortable with my current information and services"
"cheaper and more efficient technology solutions and the lessons in how to use them"
"more in depth focus on markets and world and less on short term timing and predictions of markets. more on fundementals and less on day to day"
"more thoughts on market moving events in the future"
"Comparisons and market outlook. Feel like I have to dig and click around every time I want to find something"
"I don't think I need anything actually."
"Value comparisons and information about potential issues that face the economy."
"Overall performance report for Third Party Asset manager's portfolios."
"I need more charts and information needed to understand the charts."
"Getting everything I need from current sources."
"more 10000 foot views of what the market is not all the messy details inside it."
"Can't think of anything I'm not getting"
"Asset managers are usually promoting and explaining their own products, so I use independent research sources such as Morningstar for unbiased evaluation of investment assets."
"more mkt updates to keep me more informed of the mkt"
"regulatory updates tailored to my client base and business model,  \"What does all this mean for me?\""
"For now, we are comfortable with our structure."
"Trusted \" where to move money now\" information"

"Standout individual equities by Sector/Industry. Things that I have to pay to receive now. Oftentimes, difficult to place a company into the appropriate sector based on information I receive, or their peers."
"Information on specific stocks.  Mutual funds are generally covered by asset managers"
"I need accuracy and un biased information.  I don't feel I get that anywhere right now.  I have to search several places that report on both sides of any issue."
"Potential risk associated with the investment thesis of the fund along with macro-risk that may have a direct or indirect effect on the funds performance."
"Investor Behavioral Data, Investing Psychology, Human Factors in Decision Making"
"Up to date holdings (as opposed to 3-6 months behind), better information on differentiation from peers, performance that justifies the fees."
"Not sure, asset managers tend to always be around and have info at hand when needed."
"access to better portfolio building reporting and templates"
"financial market outlook and economic perspective and non bias assessment of consumer demographics in the US"
"better marketing and peer to peer tips"
"the asset managers give me the information I need"
"Information on changes of investment (closed to new investors).  Changes in style of fund"
"accurate and unique data to help set apart provide client benefit"
"Impact of specific activity in some sectors."
"General Economic Data and Reporting Global economic activity Company Specific Information"
"Value of active management compared to just indexing"
"Non-biased news reporting and not news interpreting."
"Performance reporting comparing each investment to a relative benchmark.  Asset manager that can consistently beat it's benchmark."
"whitepapers, more transparency, tools to get new clients"
"None that I can think of or I would be accessing them"
"More true financial news that is not tainted with political opinions. Factual information that can be used without fear of truthfulness."
"boiler plate market commentary I can cut and paste and email to my clients"

"Real time impact of currency and net after currency return info.  Need broader analyst research of etf's.  Need  better sub sector info on benchmarks, return contribution and sub sector Strategic weightings  - would like etfs with better tactical currency hedges"
"Nothing in particular. I can get any of the information I need."
"More timely info on fund flows and momentum changes"
"unbiased assessment of various perspectives of financial views/information.  hard to find good analysis that isnt 'sponsored'"
"I receive all the info that I need. Nothing to note here."
"Quick, detailed summaries of investments that are easily understood and presentable to clients."
"Not sure about this one, the asset managers are pretty diligent in disseminating information via email, webcasts, etc."
"I actually believe there are more than enough source of financial news"
"Lots of managers lacking in this dept"
"I would like to get access to other types of information but its currently outside my budget. like a Bloomberg Terminal"
"niches like SRI from larger financial platforms e.g. Vanguard and Fidelity"
"I get most of what I need"
"more updated fact sheets monthly not quarterly"
"Better literature pieces to communicate the long term impacts of investing"
"Turnkey methodology of sending clients monthly electronic updates."
"Less emphasis on commingled assets and more on future direction and trends"
"more market and economic news updates that affect portfolios"
"A simplified sheet that has all pertinent info boiled down to one page"
"I am satisfied with what is available.  There is so much it is overwhelming.  Adding a new source would just be more noise."
"Articles relating to financial planning the are short and very applicable to virtually every client that include examples of the strategy."
"I think I get what I need."
"the analysis of the purchases and or sales that were done"
"More transparency and more timely information of portfolio construction and changes."
"Better turn around time on analysis.  Less mistakes."
"More direct access to portfolio management teams"
"Consistent fund updates, even in bad times."
"Unbiased info. Tools that compliance will allow."
"Clear performance Fact Sheets Continued Educational Opportunities for the changing Financial World"

"I need something that is concise with the ability to dive deeper into a story or research. Many sources restate the same stories with different catchy headlines. I don't want the fluff. I just want the information about what is going on in the world, in financial markets, and in my industry."
"More in-depth information on various funds within various sectors."
"High frequency data such as CFTC size and positioning."
"best practices and truly paying attention to what I need not what they are Selling"
"Cannot think of anything at this time."
"broad based fund analytics offering comparison of various investments.  Asset allocation software."
"more of a ,.longer term look of possible market outcomes"
"Unbiased advice through white papers or articles that are client shareable."
"Better method of merging traditional analysis with technical side of selection process"
"Access to some of the allocation tools they have. Many have access to allocation tools that they are willing to use for me and provide me the results, but I would love to have direct access."

"Better charting data and recognition of actionable market trends.  Too much noise out there with zero value.  Too much sensationalism.  Need less of each of the latter two.  Investment market news is more focused on attracting eyes rather than delivering good actionable content."
"Consistent market outlook. Not just a quarterly update halfway into the next quarter"
"Sifting through the plethora of news stories and noise, and dialing down to the true impact of world events."
"Better aggregators.  There is too much information out there.  Too much quantity, not enough quality."
"more frequent performance reporting and justification for performance"
"Market direction and how to articulate it in a portfolio"
"Need information on a more timely basis"
"I could use an in house terminal like Bloomberg"
"Timely market reporting and analysis of breaking news."
"Access to c-suite management at the publically traded companies I follow"
"Summary of thought leadership in market assumptions"
"Market data and analysis of that data"
"More information on how the investment strategy relates to clients' personal situations"
"ability to reduce workflow on small/ medium size accounts"

"Unfortunately, I feel asset manager are as chained to DOL as we are.  I don't feel they can open a lot of new funds right now due to the fact that DOL may really change their business model (1 share class, etc.)."
"More papers to share with clients about the market."
"Easier fee guidance, more product selection for specific investments."
"accuracy for non regularly covered companies without political bias"
"I receive very good service at this time.  cannot think of anything."
"Not applicable...very comfortable with the info  being currently received."
"I feel like I get too much- I guess being in the biz for over 14+ years and having a large network of wholesalers/advisors/money mangers and even competitive peers, I'm almost overinformed"
"everything. I try to remove bias of the people around me with third party data"
"They are fine, let them concentrate on managing the assets."
"this doesn't apply to me today, I get the information I need from our internal wholesalers"

"I need a way to analyze my client's total portfolio in order to recommend adjustments to allocations.  Using multiple fund families sometimes is a challenge as the asset manager can only review their portfolios unless the account is in a managed acct.  Not all of my clients need the managed acct approach nor qualify for my firms minimum investment."
"More transparency on fund structure and expenses. I would also like more information/resources on client-advisors who are growing business vs. those who are stagnant or losing business"
"Asset management I rely mostly on firm resources and peers.  I'm always looking to grow in terms of practice management and professional growth"
"Pulse of the market and potential swings"
"more research to show clients why their Fund may be underperforming the markets and why that's not a bad thing but might be a great HOLD"
"unbiased market info, trends, education for clients"
"unbiased research and analysis as it relates to portfolio construction"
"in depth analiysis and accuracy of research."
"More detailed reporting on mutual funds and performance."
"Information on scams and out there, both legal and illegal."
"proactive recommendations for what area is poised to outperform....not just spewing out the returns for the most recent hot sector."
"I don't have any suggestion to offer."
"More information about thought processes when choosing stocks."
"Getting new clients, getting advantages over robo advisors, and keeping clients through crazy economic time"
"easy to use consolidated customizable news source"
"I think the information is out there"
"I receive regular emails from the asset managers but most is not valuable to me.  The amount of email information is overwhelming so I choose not to read most of it."
"Information that is more targeted to my specific needs"
"Morningstar and AssetMark provide great info and services"
"Nothing really; DFA and back office provide all that is needed."
"More practice management and business building support.  Branding, social media marketing, unique planning ideas, referral marketing, etc"
"unbiased information ... too often information is colored by politics"
"I get good information from the asset managers we work with."
"as I said before, where are the strongest opportunities"
"digestible market information that can be sent to clients in digital format"
"quicker access and summaries of what is happening, so I'm not wasting time sifting through bias slants"
"More global information, what else and what is doing in the marketplace. Differentiation is key so I look for that."
"Future potential economic conditions and impacts to markets."
"would love more information on portfolio management/allocation and historical returns that come with it"
"Articles we can share on social media"
"I don't work with asset managers.  I am an asset manager."
"up to date info, most reports are from past/previous"
"I get a lot of good information form all my sources."
"Integrating products from outside their platforms to accomplish goals. It is against their self-interest to recommend individual bonds in place of a bond fund for example."
"Unsure.  As time goes on, they should create their own information portfolios prebuilding the argument (with supporting data) to show why choosing them is meeting my fiduciary responsibility."
"none at this point. I have sought out appropriate means of news unbiased , accurate sources."
"timely info on what changes they are making"
"More specific asset allocation recommendations for the current market environment."
"Nothing that I can think of right now."
"Would like to have access to a Bloomberg terminal"
"More information on how their strategies are applicable to helping clients, especially when they are trailing the markets."
"Accurate information that is objective and not based on current hype"
"quicker than quarterly portfolio updates on holdings"
"better consolidation of earnings/valuations; breaking news through out the day."
"I'm pretty comfortable with the information that I'm receiving currently."
"More client centric brand rep wholesalers vs sell the hot dot"
"advanced portfolio construction tools e.g. factor analysis, risk modeling, monte carlo analysis, etc."
"I work with managers that provide information."
"more high quality white papers regarding , with more technical research"
"I have all of the information I need / want"
"Not much. Occasionally we ask for direct conversation with specific managers."
"Asset managers seem to provide all the information I need.  We work primarily with index funds."
"Market conditions and reasoning behind their decisions"
"I feel I get an adequate amount of information"
"not much - less contact from internal wholesalers."

"Asset managers can provide us with better understanding of market trends on a macro level. They can see asset movements all over the world (or have access to that information) Relaying that information to us helps us adjust portfolios to better take advantage of market trends. Keeping us \"in the loop\" helps tremendously."
"Clear explanation of products and rationale behind allocations."

"For our clients / book, we focus on three issues that tend to derail their financial plans: 1) Inflation 2) Lifestyle  3) Behavior  Most of the products and materials around them focus on \"we're better than the next guy\" in terms of performance or downside risk.  The real problem (or edge) isn't with the product, but with the client themselves.  Clients seek annuities to protect downside when they cannot stomach the volatility that is required to achieve the returns they need to sustain their bloated lifestyle relative to their resources.  Instead of addressing these fundamental problems, the clients are caught up in the marketing hype of magic bullet solutions that can get them all the upside with none of the downside.  If the asset managers, and their marketing departments, could begin focusing on the real underlying problems and how their products can be a part of the solution instead of how they're 0.07% better than their competitor, then they'd get a flood of new business.  Apple didn't sell FaceTime by spouting all it's technical parameters, they sold it with emotional stories like a deaf couple signing to one another.  What's the real problem their product solves?"
"better information on market forecast and market views as opposed to constantly pushing the next best product..."
"What innovation is taking place? Where are the risks?"
"The industry doesn't show rolling return data vs the bench.  that is what we like to use."

"I feel satisfied with the level I'm currently getting"
